question.text:
pBR322 has restriction sites for many restriction endonucleases. Which of these enzymes acting on pBR322 is not correctly matched with its source?

I. PvuI: Providencia vulgaris
II. ClaI: Caryophanon latum
III. SalI: Streptomyces albus
IV. PstI: Proteus stuarti

solution.text:
pBR322 has the following regions:

ori: Region for origin for replication. rop: This region codes for the proteins involved in the replication of plasmid. This region also has recognition sequence for restriction endonuclease Pvu II (Proteus vulgaris). tetR - This region provides resistance against the antibiotic tetracycline. This region also has recognition sequence for restriction endonucleases: Bam H I from Bacillus amyloliquefaciens and Sal I from Streptomyces albus. ampR - This region provides resistance against the antibiotic ampicillin. This region also has recognition sequence for restriction endonucleases: Pvu I from Proteus vulgaris and Pst I from Providencia stuarti. Apart from these, pBR 322 also shows recognition sequence for restriction endonucleases: EcoR I from Escherichia coli, Hind III from Haemophilus influenza, Cla I from Caryophanon latum
